document.title: Illinois Learning Standards for Foreign Languages

1496C0387F2F4D04BD2BAE6527C19A2A.description: Use the target language to evaluate a career option which requires proficiency in the target language through a career exploration or education-to-careers activity.

1980C2AE7E674B92B386E93C2181ACEF.description: Use the target language to analyze data relating to job opportunities, preparation, wages/salaries, etc., of occupations in areas where the target language is spoken.

E888506AB36B49BA90677093759F346D.description: Use the target language to analyze connections between specific businesses and industries in areas where the target language is spoken and in the United States.

3921002D8F424B7E88D046D26C2525BE.description: Use the target language to compare various occupations in terms of their roles, status and qualifications in areas where the target language is spoken and in the United States.

B491CE2320704CC98AE0D59DB4859029.description: Use the target language to explain in detail the preparation for and activities of specific careers in which the target language can be used.

D620718195AE403C98204E513717DF05.description: Use the target language to identify and describe occupations unique to areas where the target language is spoken.

DF7FDE666AFD4FDC90630DBCB70CB9CB.description: Use the target language to explain and describe general career choices in which the target language can be used.

2E6C06A83F4F40719402F791138E34FC.description: Use the target language to describe activities and characteristics of selected occupations and work places.

5A1994333E4B451D9F0A00A9B659B3B7.description: Use target language vocabulary to identify a variety of professions in which the target language may be used.

48C8078F30EC4A21A296507B6071331E.description: Use target language vocabulary to identify common professions and occupations.

FD840591DCCA4AC2B93B5B4DE3C34D1E.description: Use the target language to demonstrate knowledge and understanding of a variety of career options.

086E07374A474514B0107BB3A4113C6E.description: Use the target language to analyze and contrast diet, nutrition and physical fitness programs in areas where the target language is spoken with those of the United States.

083B21DFEAA84E769146C35A0BB0A131.description: Use the target language to analyze current science issues (e.g., ecology and the environment, space exploration, health) from the perspective of speakers of the language.

062F60DA014846BDB7BC600C65B7559C.description: Use the target language for math skills such as statistical analysis, estimating and approximating in experiments or research projects.

71A11C0EACDF46169C39C7D758A479CD.description: Describe and explain factors affecting economic conditions in target language country(ies) compared to the United States.

F7D4F1940DB244CAA7B2673BD4EE3582.description: Use the target language to describe and compare daily diet, nutrition and physical fitness regimens in areas where the target language is spoken.

2E88467CBFCF464DA2E3B32A20C6E426.description: Use the target language to analyze the impact of human activity on the natural environment in areas where the target language is spoken.

43BE0C76577043DCA85DE86862662FE3.description: Use the target language to analyze and solve math problems based on timetables, schedules, charts and graphs in the target language.

940DC6C75EEF4AFEAF3809305222D9D7.description: Identify major sources of employment and income in target language country(ies) compared to the United States.

DD006FDA9D974823A402CBEA5D8723F7.description: Use the target language to identify diet, nutrition and physical fitness issues in areas where the target language is spoken.

298469F1D53449CA84B26A74C8B7F654.description: Use the target language to describe the physical and geological features, vegetation and animal life indigenous to areas where the target language is spoken.

0267815D5C8E455E99B6C7ED68D14473.description: Use the target language to gather and organize data to solve math problems.

9D854C2045FF45AEBBACEA3C2ADB1BF5.description: Identify differing systems of trade and exchange in target language country(ies) (e.g., bartering and bargaining) compared to the United States.

E76E956A5ABE40DDBB83CB7FECF67A1A.description: Use the target language to participate in and/or describe games, dances and sports.

1668AAE29C284A478D27469CD20FB99D.description: Use target language vocabulary to identify and describe basic earth science content (e.g., mountain range, coast, desert) and life forms.

EFC9D2014F74466CA773512A0EFD4502.description: Use the target language to make, use and estimate measurements (e.g., time, linear, monetary).

41692691FAC046498D4ED6D488F763B5.description: Identify products that are from the countries where the target language is spoken and that are found in the United States economy.

B1CAE8F82BB34B2C9E642E0E21E25D0F.description: Use target language vocabulary while participating in physical activities (e.g., games, dances).

84F0F7071A9E4B96AED5EEEC4F41D9D0.description: Use target language vocabulary to identify simple science terms referring to weather and nature (e.g., clouds, wind, trees, common animals).

8280E718C9C14DF88CC6DED344A0D9D9.description: Use the target language to solve simple math exercises (e.g., identify simple geometric shapes, use numbers to count and do math computations).

C6536DD8313543AF8BC458AD1E8C2411.description: Recognize the currency of the country(ies) where the target language is spoken and compare values with United States currency.

CD3145C659B044BA86FCD5B3C6C1144D.description: Use the target language to reinforce and further knowledge of other disciplines.

B4D64B5EA10C483B97563225FA47754A.description: Use the target language to make connections and reinforce knowledge and skills across academic, vocational and technical disciplines.

E321A116EE2142C2A69A346B12F86E63.description: Describe how migration, settlement and colonization have affected the economy and environment of country(ies) where the target language is spoken.

07ECA2F2A61D4327A7C1F8315823622A.description: Compare a target country with the United States using geographic representations to illustrate and explain their economic nature.

310098BB4D1D46C1AEB263919B285CA4.description: Describe geographical aspects (e.g., population distribution, natural resources and main economic activities) of areas where the target language is spoken.

685622C9886B419CAB1584AF1D025124.description: Use maps, charts, digital images, graphs and other geographic representations to describe and discuss the countries where the target language is spoken.

BFD6E62CF492438AB36DA617B07D3C13.description: Identify and use simple geography vocabulary (e.g., border, city, river, soil, equator) of the target language.

49BE82DE568F49648CFDD215A7FB5CE2.description: Understand geography of various target language societies.

79176C546DF24CCBB9F7911C2D5F0C51.description: Analyze different perspectives of historical events using a variety of media and technology tools.

7BDAB5ECE927426FBD21812E0BFE7951.description: Compare and contrast the influences of historical figures and events and their impact on the development of their countries.

D4D6A207DF9D44448629B41F9FB14B3A.description: Identify key historical figures (e.g., scientists, mathematicians, inventors, business leaders) and events associated with areas where the target language is spoken and explain their influence.

44850803F9DE460DB773E5CB430E98B5.description: Use simple history vocabulary to identify historical concepts and trends (e.g., rise and fall of the Roman Empire, French Revolution).

9E0BE043C8E64EA5985CAB188178CA32.description: Recognize important people and events (e.g., special celebrations) in the history of areas where the target language is spoken.

075ECF833673431288A8EAA61974D322.description: Understand history of areas where the target language is spoken.

53470782137D4AF292BAA772CFADF1F8.description: Compare topics, types and styles of media communication in areas where the target language is spoken.

5EB6BA5449AB467C83854E582F3ADE8D.description: Explain the influence of historical context on form, style and point of view for a variety of literary works.

0AF6410534FC49DEB0E20F75CFC84324.description: Compare and analyze literary themes, styles and perspectives across authors and genres.

0E9345C7C2D145ABA837064EDCBDB9C5.description: Comprehend main ideas from target language media in relation to everyday life.

F89AC6E2A1D34145BF2B6F3A3F0FA77B.description: Describe characteristics, origins and authors of various literary forms using target language vocabulary.

D37EB892F6FA4A03949D3E777566A136.description: Compare and contrast the characters, setting, themes and plot of two or more literary works.

AED4842B4C8E485CA6097C2D53B1DA85.description: Create simple print and/or non-print media messages in the target language modeled on media examples (e.g., advertisements, posters, television, radio, brochures, websites).

BDD3E1B2D7134C779EFAC3C9E3051434.description: Read, discuss and write about plot and form of selected literary works as illustrated in comic books, youth literature and abridgments in the target language using target language vocabulary.

A8BE04C75B3346F0B522A5BD130474DC.description: Read, discuss and write about themes and settings of selected materials in the target language with assistance of glossaries, guided questions or outlines.

F4D682FC81DD468DAE8F5296F731E6EA.description: Summarize the main points of selected media presentations in the target language.

BAF9392D2F8242EE9C8F415A73DAEE62.description: Identify sample literary works and their authors representative of the target language.

C35CDF9C2D504D49BD17E8C0CC1486C7.description: Read, retell and summarize selected literary works.

95417382D8214CA4B989EE0042361AF0.description: Identify primary media sources (e.g., television, radio, CD/ROM, software, films, on-line resources, websites, periodicals) in the target language.

DA5253C06AA2426B8ED7E1C5D6E66D2D.description: Identify different types of literature (e.g., poetry, short stories, plays, legends) in the target language.

1540F486780244BAB8A3D803D4BCE262.description: Identify main characters, settings and events from selected samples of children's literature using audio and visual cues.

85905A58F2CE42C3880DD6D53A5B12D8.description: Understand literature and various media of target language societies.

0DEAB5B73DD1448D8C1284B765ED4AD0.description: Create an interpretive presentation of a selected art form based on research or a field experience.

ECAC4105E8C54490859DDE4E7C409CE3.description: Explain the cultural and historical significance of characteristic art forms of a target language society.

F85C241C3BF5469CB04DC2E652721D21.description: Compare and contrast selected art forms of areas where the target language is spoken.

CD36D25C5DE34A74A56408018B4466E7.description: Compare themes that are inherent to areas where the target language is spoken as expressed in different art forms.

95DE7A2B085B43328F62108F51CC0BFB.description: Understand and use the essential target language vocabulary referring to tools, processes and products in one or more of the art forms.

5AAA44C0AB3545D69357D9D02227AA28.description: Identify and explain ideas and themes expressed in selected works of art associated with target language societies using terms from the target language.

BFA6AA6463354A528C8C53A51E0E7CDA.description: Describe selected art forms of areas where the target language is spoken using arts vocabulary from the target language.

E7E9EBCC2ECA445E8259D474FE85EA91.description: Identify sample art works and their creators associated with areas where the target language is spoken.

0D383AFE62AB401C9A1DCD88AE570E7E.description: Demonstrate one or more art forms representative of areas where the target language is spoken (e.g., dramatizing a sample of children's literature, performing a song or dance).

4567BE66554D439CA88B6C5061DF6AA2.description: Identify one or more art forms (e.g., Japanese origami, Spanish flamenco) representative of areas where the target language is spoken.

E2195C18B3F4484F8BBEB3F711462760.description: Understand music, dance, folk art, visual art, drama and architecture related to the target language societies.

16078F504F044EC2AC2664532A634458.description: Analyze and interpret manners and customs within the social, academic and work environments of selected target language societies.

356FDCDA2A5E42B0B3DE5D51A2953E0C.description: Demonstrate target language expressions and levels of formality (e.g., age, social status) appropriate for entry-level work and social situations.

E731DCD1869546D6B9F989201584519D.description: Demonstrate selected customs, manners and traditions in societies associated with the target language.

8B0BE819E54A4C51B9DB905C70BCBF5E.description: Demonstrate activities (e.g., games, songs and role playing) associated with the target language.

F600BA0612F34A03BC59BA4A65631CA3.description: Use common forms of courtesy, greetings and leave-takings appropriate to the time of day and relationship (adult, peer, parent).

FBED5514E5854001B52F7F6F2E6044AF.description: Understand manners and customs of various target language societies.

1F707C1FA89E4CD9B5ABCDC974D9FA78.description: Use the target language to develop an understanding of the customs, arts, literature, history and geography associated with the target language.

9305E3C5EC7A44C0B370EF1D8B8F1B77.description: Present an original piece (e.g., essay, story, poem) on a theme of their choice with minimal guidance.

17FC1CCCE3EC4AB4A396B0E48EDDD0B4.description: Make impromptu presentations in a variety of academic, social and work situations.

CCCC8994C08A44819FAA068AF4A1DC0B.description: Write documents in a variety of forms with supporting evidence from electronic and print sources to meet academic, social and work needs.

E0C82A509170494B85DE38FE843E3429.description: Present a short original piece (e.g., essay, story, poem) on a given theme with some guidelines.

67CF6842BFB3412698829051684E23B0.description: Make a persuasive presentation with documentation (e.g., visuals, interviews, quotes) from target language sources.

819423B6404F49B3AE14A14388C8F392.description: Write complete expository pieces that include description, definition and analysis for a variety of situations.

E68AD91BE6D14BD3B9D4604A408F6A74.description: Present a simple, original poem or story based on a model.

3B4EF406B9DB4F6C9F03CB2F73E37F2D.description: Present findings from research on unfamiliar topics (e.g., the Roman army, the French chateaux, origins of chocolate).

06FF26CC5FCB47F2AD6DEDF4579FC00F.description: Write compositions and reports with a specific focus, supporting details, logical sequence and conclusion.

30EFEE85D85944FEA6AA4790EAAD7EEE.description: Present an original production (e.g., TV commercials, ads, skits, songs) using known vocabulary and grammatical structures.

C98E61331F44432F86BD91956728C4B1.description: Present a simple written or oral report on familiar topics.

155AEEF235B44D1EAE754B05B051AEFB.description: Write on familiar topics using appropriate grammar, punctuation and capitalization.

B4D524ACD7F449CFB1C1100AFB4EE174.description: Describe people, activities and objects from school and home.

6B119B00D22846D8821E2B629E8A8482.description: Copy/write words, phrases and simple sentences.

E321EAAF937F4081A13428CFF7E55A58.description: Use the target language to present information, concepts and ideas for a variety of purposes to different audiences.

ADE8C5B19120424EA2A706BE7F55563E.description: Explain how various languages are interrelated in terms of word origin and text structures.

50F7197F0B6246FDBDC0B934DD9508BB.description: Distinguish nuances of meaning in a variety of contexts (e.g., layers of meaning in poetry and prose).

6CD1FC08AA154D9FA9E961B87DED7A8F.description: Comprehend, with little or no support, a variety of materials intended for native speakers in academic, social and work situations.

E91DD2626B6E4155A5448DFD19C1B02D.description: Compare the target language with one or more languages in terms of vocabulary, word use, phrase and sentence structure and complete text structures.

465BE12325F142B389D0B32820E64A6B.description: Demonstrate understanding of written materials by organizing information and concepts (e.g., outlines, flow charts).

20B9C9FBF3B14AE9A238029ED9421316.description: Comprehend key vocabulary as well as the main message of complex written materials without the help of visuals.

D271CDB379804B65BA101086BE35E5F3.description: Compare word use, phrasing and sentence structures of the target language with those used in one or more other languages.

10731D158FD7478D8D4AC8F74D65D69D.description: Comprehend the main message of a variety of written materials with the help of resources (e.g., dictionary, thesaurus, software, Internet, e-mail) to expand vocabulary.

DE86E7F58F1E4699AE724ADFE1C05C97.description: Decode new vocabulary using con-textual clues and drawing on words and phrases from prior lessons.

E15587C9D06D4B16A88865AE8BFAE15F.description: Comprehend written classroom directions, read simple passages, infer meaning of cognates and recognize loan words.

C7D6ED47277C417A8B2B0DF8F9FD9FEE.description: Infer meaning of cognates from context.

4E5DA94665CA4009B596C45072D2D7AD.description: Recognize the written form of familiar spoken language and predict meaning of key words in a simple story, poem or song.

2DD816F44F834C70A0B97E124E75F1C0.description: Understand written passages in the target language.

95074A8AA9B74F8298DD55F852311954.description: Approximate native-like pronunciation, intonation and inflection.

7F7F0246D0024A28BFBE4D64E0F7B2E0.description: Discuss and defend a position on an issue in a discussion.

BCDA976F448D45BF93E16201A3EC9F4D.description: Recognize and use nonverbal cues in various formal and informal settings.

927066C7DD9B4FFEB913E4261EEA6734.description: Express differences of meaning using proper pronunciation, intonation and inflection.

20A9CA16B3F84EB49FC25D31833BE288.description: Engage in extended conversations in a variety of situations.

30E0A1B22E114FF79D770AFCC35497C3.description: Use appropriate non-verbal cues common in areas where the target language is spoken.

096F155D6221414690CAB2D912EC5D39.description: Produce language with improved pronunciation, intonation and inflection.

206B95190C8F4EE6AB7EEB4D63E8A0F2.description: Respond to open-ended questions and initiate communication in various situations.

3A3FB6A7AC8649BDBD7573FCB6C77B95.description: Comprehend gestures and body language often used in everyday interaction in the target language.

466E55B8EEEC41FDA412915CD22B84EE.description: Produce language using proper pronunciation, intonation and inflection.

2C4A20AE0DB142E7AEB60731B860CA22.description: Pose questions spontaneously in structured situations.

8AB74493AAE24C95908386780E2D3531.description: Imitate pronunciation, intonation and inflection including sounds unique to the target language.

A8BA5994DF9243C99BA0713906950381.description: Respond to and ask simple questions with prompts.

B731A3FCA35C42508F115B3414B40113.description: Interact in the target language in various settings.

1E37282AD3DD4C1AB084A1DE232327FF.description: Comprehend a variety of oral and audio presentations in academic, technical, social or work environments.

3E1843B990E540CF86AD0D344C475E9C.description: Comprehend details of oral and audio presentations unsupported by visual aids.

E13D8A729DD047128DF8A6640E69E5A1.description: Follow instructions in the target language as given in multistep segments for assignments and activities in and out of the classroom.

EEC8EE53FA0C46D6949BC746E16B81CE.description: Comprehend main messages of simple oral and audio presentations with assistance from resources (e.g., glossaries, guided questions, outlines).

F3E7F6912E3A464F8ED279A128916D66.description: Follow instructions in the target language, given one step at a time, for a wide range of activities.

3F702D1CE2F649FEA40ACE7844068FA4.description: Comprehend illustrated stories, audiovisual programs or websites.

C2E067F9793A4066B3B289D48FB8ADBF.description: Respond appropriately to simple commands in the target language.

58560482BB8A405683C14FC2FF50EB46.description: Recognize basic language patterns (e.g., forms of address, questions, case).

2701DE4CEC6D47A2BB38A8C8FA83A150.description: Understand oral communication in the target language.

DA044A15BE114978AACE5C20DE9D4FDD.description: Use the target language to communicate within and beyond the classroom setting.
